Pre-Game Insights: Quentin Grimes has stepped up over the past seven games with Luka Doncic sidelined by a left calf strain.
Grimes has averaged 15.6 points, 5.7 rebounds, and 4 assists in the seven games that Doncic has missed.
Grimes recorded team highs in points (23) and rebounds (nine) while dishing out six assists in a 118-97 victory over the Los Angeles Lakers.
Grimes made 18 of 46 3-point attempts (39.1 percent) over the past seven games.
Kyrie Irving has missed three straight games and four of the past five due to shoulder and back injuries and an illness, and will not play on Thursday.
Doncic is expected to return late this month at the earliest.
Portland has relied on a balanced attack, with six scorers in double figures in a 119-100 win over the New Orleans Pelicans.
Deni Avdija paced Portland with 26 points, while Shaedon Sharpe finished with 21 and Anfernee Simons 17.
Reserve Robert Williams III made an impact with four points, six rebounds, and four blocks in 16 minutes of action after not playing in six of the previous seven games.
Trail Blazers coach Chauncey Billups could be planning on utilizing Williams more to take some pressure off Deandre Ayton and Donovan Clingan down low.
Clingan is expected to be back for the meeting with Dallas.
Thursday will mark the fourth and final battle between the teams this season. The Mavericks beat the Trail Blazers twice before Portland won 126-122 on Dec. 28.
